title: 108_hr3495
content: Section 629 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to establish an Emergency Preparedness Demonstration Program to assist disadvantaged communities. The Director will establish an emergency preparedness demonstration program to help disadvantaged communities improve their capacity for emergency programs through grants or contracts with eligible nonprofit organizations. These organizations can use the funding to research emergency preparedness and disaster response awareness in households of disadvantaged individuals in urban and rural areas. The program aims to conduct research on emergency preparedness and disaster response awareness in disadvantaged households in urban and rural areas impacted by disasters. It also focuses on developing and promoting emergency preparedness education programs within these communities. The program focuses on developing culturally competent educational materials for disadvantaged communities to promote emergency preparedness. Eligible organizations must be nonprofit organizations with a primary mission of providing such services. The program requires nonprofit organizations serving disadvantaged communities to partner with disadvantaged business enterprises, including those in HUBZones, to qualify for grants. Recipients can only use funds for acquiring professional services. The program requires nonprofit organizations serving disadvantaged communities to partner with disadvantaged business enterprises, including those in HUBZones, to qualify for grants. Recipients can use funds for acquiring professional services, developing informational materials for emergency preparedness, and establishing consortia with national organizations. The program requires nonprofit organizations serving disadvantaged communities to partner with disadvantaged business enterprises to qualify for grants. Recipients can use funds for acquiring professional services, developing informational materials for emergency preparedness, and establishing consortia with national organizations to disseminate information about emergency preparedness to disadvantaged communities. To be eligible for a grant, an organization must partner with institutions serving disadvantaged individuals and submit an application to the Director. To be eligible for a grant, an organization must submit an application to the Director, accompanied by required information. The Director will establish a procedure for accepting applications. Definitions in this section include 'disadvantaged business enterprise' as a business owned and controlled by disadvantaged individuals. In this section, definitions for 'disadvantaged business enterprise,' 'disadvantaged community,' and 'disadvantaged individual' are provided. Definitions for 'disadvantaged individual' and 'HUBZone' are provided, along with authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2004 through 2007.
